subject: Re: [junit] juint autometically
msgSnippet: ... This sounds like a very interesting tool for adding tests to legacy code, and completely useless for Test-Driven Development. It sounds to me to be worth
messageBody:
Shivam giri wrote:
> Mr.Neelabh
> yes it is possible ..actually autometically you are exercising your
> jav code by calling all the methods by using broad range of input
> values in a variety of sequence..and reporting the result.
> After this process some observation will come..here observation are
> description of behavoiur.if you feel this observtaion are intended
> behavoiur promote them to valid assertion.
> Every assertion became a test cases for you..
> hope you got it now..
> Any problem let me know

This sounds like a very interesting tool for adding tests to legacy
code, and completely useless for Test-Driven Development. It sounds to
me to be worth trying. I wish I had a project to which to point it.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
